title: Display user profile name as forum message author

requirements.text: Update the forum message display in the Section Detail page (frontend/src/pages/SectionDetailPage.tsx) so that each message shows the user's saved profile name as the author name instead of displaying the principal or an anonymous/unauthenticated fallback.

quotes: Hey chst can you make the forum message section to where each person name thst they setup for their profile be their messaging name?

acceptanceCriteria: Forum messages display the author's profile name (from the user profile they set up) instead of principal or anonymous label
If a user has not set up a profile name, show a reasonable fallback (e.g., 'Anonymous' or 'User')
The change applies to all messages in the forum section detail view
Backend may need to return profile names alongside messages, or frontend must fetch profiles for message authors

requirements.text: Update the backend forum message data structure and retrieval method so that when messages are fetched for a section, each message includes the author's saved profile name (if available) in addition to the principal, so the frontend can display the correct author name without separate profile lookups.

quotes: Hey chst can you make the forum message section to where each person name thst they setup for their profile be their messaging name?

acceptanceCriteria: Backend message retrieval includes the author's profile name field for each message
If the author has no saved profile, the name field is empty or a default value
The Candid interface for forum messages is updated to include the author name field
Frontend receives author names without needing separate getUserProfile queries per message

constraints: Do not change the existing forum UI design, colors, or layout
Preserve the existing message posting, deletion, and admin controls
Ensure anonymous/guest users can still view messages with author names displayed correctly
nonGoals: Adding profile pictures or avatars to forum messages
Implementing @mentions or user tagging in messages
Changing the forum section creation or deletion logic
Modifying the auto-refresh or scrolling behavior
